2: Two distinct leaves are present, typically the pair of cotyledons or the first two true leaves.
3: The plantlet has three fully developed leaves.
4: Four distinct leaves are visible on the young plant.
5: The plant has grown to have five fully formed leaves.
6: Six leaves are clearly visible and developed on the plant.
7: The plant shows seven distinct, fully expanded leaves.
8: Eight leaves are present on the developing plant.
9+: The plant has nine or more fully developed leaves, indicating a more mature stage of early growth.
